intro: Endiandra virens, commonly known as the green endiandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
